body.p: It is apparent that users are willing to trade a degree of reliability in segment information for more relevant information. The AIMR’s 1993 position paper states:

lq.p: Analysts need financial statements structured so as to be consistent with how the business is organized and managed. That means that two different companies in the same industry may have to report segment data differently because they are structured differently themselves. [page 20]

body.p: But, as previously noted, the position paper says that, under those circumstances, analysts “would assume more responsibility for making meaningful comparisons of those data to the unlike data of other firms that conduct their business differently” (page 61).
